snippet: The Commerce Department’s report led to some economists’ reducing their estimates for growth in the April-June quarter.
abstract: Commerce Department reports June retail sales fell 0.5 percent from May; notes second-quarter sales rose 4.7 percent compared with year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department’s report led to some economists’ reducing their estimates for growth in the April-June quarter.

headline.seo: Decrease in Retail Spending Hurts Economic Outlook
